fields.summary: Unable to change Presets when the Preset list contains Preset names using special characters or Preset names that are sorted higher alphabetically then the word Default.

issuetype.description: A task that needs to be done.
issuetype.name: Task

fields.summary: Allow saving and loading of graphic settings and ability to control view of "blinged" avatars

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Defect

comments.body: Sorry Whirly, I could not reproduce any of these problems.

Heya Jonathan,

I went to test again but the latest build of the test viewer (http://automated-builds-secondlife-com.s3.amazonaws.com/hg/repo/jonathan_storm-2082/rev/297515/index.html) doesn't have the benchmark crash fix (BUG-7783) in it yet. I am away from home at the moment and my only SL access is my laptop which suffers from the benchmark crash so I cannot run the test viewer currently.

Managed to test on my Dads desktop.
I can still reproduce this.
{code}
Second Life 3.7.21 (297515) Dec 16 2014 10:11:21 (Second Life Test)
Release Notes

You are at 112.5, 93.3, 21.7 in Testylvania Sandbox located at sim10201.agni.lindenlab.com (216.82.49.67:13001)
SLURL: http://maps.secondlife.com/secondlife/Testylvania%20Sandbox/112/93/22
(global coordinates 332,656.0, 306,269.0, 21.7)
Second Life Server 14.12.05.297277
Retrieving...

CPU: Intel(R) Core(TM)2 Quad CPU    Q8300  @ 2.50GHz (2493.75 MHz)
Memory: 3326 MB
OS Version: Microsoft Windows Vista 32-bit Service Pack 2 (Build 6002)
Graphics Card Vendor: NVIDIA Corporation
Graphics Card: GeForce GT 230/PCIe/SSE2

Windows Graphics Driver Version: 9.18.0013.1106
OpenGL Version: 3.3.0

libcurl Version: libcurl/7.38.0 OpenSSL/1.0.1h zlib/1.2.8
J2C Decoder Version: KDU v7.0
Audio Driver Version: FMOD Ex 4.44.31
Qt Webkit Version: 4.7.1 (version number hard-coded)
Voice Server Version: Vivox 4.6.0009.20030

Built with MSVC version 1600
Packets Lost: 0/7,260 (0.0%)
{code}

Additionally, if I am set to Preset A and change to Preset B (where Preset A & Preset B have names which do not trigger this bug) and then close the preferences floater with "OK" then reopen the preferences floater, the active preset name shows as Preset A, where expected behaviour should be the name shows as Preset B.

I can make a video of this when I'm back home if you still cannot repro it.

Good news!
Bug no longer reproduces on the latest build: Second Life 3.7.21 (298530) Jan 24 2015 04:59:04 (Second Life Test)
This issue can be closed  :)

Testing system:
{code}

fields.description:
*Affected build:* Second Life 3.7.21 (297515) Dec 16 2014 10:11:21 (Second Life Test)

h2. Steps To Reproduce - Part 1

* Login on clean settings.
* Go to Preferences -> Graphics -> Advanced
* Make an obvious change to graphics settings, for example disable basic shaders
* Go to "Save as" in the Presets section.
* Save Preset with the name *Übercool* (note the Ü has an umlaut)
* Observe that Übercool is now showing as your selected preset and that basic shaders are disabled.

* Change back to the Default preset.

h2. Observed Behaviour

* After choosing the Default preset in the drop down menu, Übercool preset still shows as the active preset.
* Graphics settings have changed to the Default preset.

* Delete the Übercool preset and create a new preset named *Ubercool* (no umlaut) and observe that you can toggle between the Ubercool and Default preset and everything works as expected.

h2. Steps To Reproduce - Part 2

* Delete the Übercool preset.
* Make a change to graphics settings (disable basic shaders) and save this change with preset name *123*
* Observe that 123 is now showing as your selected preset and that basic shaders are disabled.
* Change back to the Default preset.

h2. Observed Behaviour

* After choosing the Default preset in the drop down menu, 123 preset still shows as the active preset.
* Graphics settings have changed to the Default preset.


h2. Steps To Reproduce - Part 3

* Delete all custom presets.
* Go to Preferences -> Graphics -> Advanced
* Make a change to graphics settings (disable basic shaders) and save this change with preset name *Dffault* (note it is dFfault, not dEfault)
* Observe that Dffault is now showing as your selected preset and that basic shaders are disabled.
* Observe that you can toggle between the Dffault and Default preset and everything works as expected.

* Delete the preset named Dffault
* Make a change to graphics settings (disable basic shaders) and save this change with preset name *Dafault* (note it is dAfault, not dEfault)
* Observe that Dafault is now showing as your selected preset and that basic shaders are disabled.

* Change back to the Default preset.


h2. Observed Behaviour

* Any preset name which is sorted higher alphabetically then the word "Default" will reproduce this bug.
* After choosing the Default preset in the drop down menu, Dafault preset still shows as the active preset.
* Graphics settings have changed to the Default preset.
----



* Preset names containing * or @ or ! etc all reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed
